review_text:
I've never used a collagen supplement before so I wasn't sure what to expect. I've been using it for a couple weeks now and I can't say I've noticed a marked difference in my skin. Perhaps my skin was already wonderful. :)

I will say for a supplement, this is one of the best tasting ones I've tried. I am always on the look out for new supplements and vitamins, etc. and I really like to try new things to promote skin quality, hair and nail growth, etc. Often the powders or pills or liquids are pretty tough to choke down. I tried a different collagen powder that made me gag so I was kind of worried about trying this.

This is a liquid, but not too viscose. It's thicker than water but easily drinkable and quite tasty. It's a sweet orange flavor. The package says you can add it to smoothies, but I just drink it straight. It does need to stay refrigerated which could be annoying depending on the space available in your refrigerator.

I would probably give it 4 stars for the taste, but the price is so high, and since I haven't noticed a difference I felt I had to knock one more star off. 99 dollars is a lot of money.
title: Tastes good, but I haven't noticed a difference in my skin

review_text: 613 blonde wig has cascading waves. Unit has precut sideburns. Had to tint lace, lace did good with chemicals and did not deteriorate. Hair is great quality.

This comes in an outer product box. It‚Äôs made in China. The tube this comes in is nice. It has a matte look to it.

The contour stick was what really interested me in this set. So many cream contour sticks labeled as ‚Äúcontour‚Äù end up being really warm toned. Contour is supposed to mimic your natural shadows, so it‚Äôs supposed to be cool toned, even grey toned. But, it‚Äôs hard to find one that‚Äôs actually cool toned, and even harder finding one that‚Äôs grey toned. This one looked like it was neutral, leaning cool with a kind of rosy undertone. So, I wanted to give it a try. The few rosy/pink toned contour/bronzer sticks I‚Äôve found have worked well for me as bronzers because I have neutral leaning slightly cool skin.

On me, thus leans more warm toned than I‚Äôd like. But, once blended out, it isn‚Äôt as orange as others. Of course, it could be different for you, depending on your undertone. While it doesn‚Äôt work as a contour for me like it wanted, it does make a nice bronzer for me. The formula of it is nice. It‚Äôs soft, smooth, creamy. It blends easily. I never swipe sticks like these onto my face. I always take my sponge or brush, dab it onto the stick, and then blend it onto my skin. I find that works better and I don‚Äôt need to worry about whether swiping it directly on will lift my foundation underneath. This is pigmented, but it blends out so easily that it‚Äôs easy to blend it away. I find if I pick up and apply a little, it blends out easily and looks natural on my skin but I just need to be careful not to blend it away! But, I can also build it up for a more intense color. I like that. Once blended out, it is matte and dries down to a powder like finish that I don‚Äôt need to set and it lasts all day without any issues.

The highlighter is okay. It‚Äôs too glittery for my liking. I like more of a pearl look without glitter. But if you don‚Äôt mind micro glitter, you might like this. Its really subtle aside from the glitter so I just think there‚Äôs better options.

Overall, I think it‚Äôs worth it for the contour/bronzer side. It works really well and is easy to work with (when dabbing your brush/sponge onto the stick and then applying it) and it sets down on its own with a matte powder like finish without needing to be set. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend the highlighter. It‚Äôs just really sheer other than glitter so I think there‚Äôs better options. But, if you like a sheer but glittery highlighter, then this could work for you. I give it 4 stars because I really like the bronzer, I just don‚Äôt like the highlighter.
title: Nice bronzer but don‚Äôt like the highlighter

review_text: Good quality with a very pretty design. The teeth are widely spaced and glide smoothly when combing hair. It comes with a faux leather pouch to store it in. It‚Äôs a nice little addition. For $30.00, this seems a little excessive. I wouldn‚Äôt pay that much for this comb.

review_text:
InstaNatural: Cellulite Cream

This product is part of their Body Creams collection and helps with everything from the cellulite to the dimples a person may suffer from. You get a boost from:

Caffeine- Derived from green tea, which provides you with instant firming and lifting results
Retinol- allows the skin to resurface at a quicker pace, lessening the appearance of the cellulite/dimples
Cocoa Butter- softens and also helps keep the skin looking beautiful
Shea Butter- allows the ‚Äúnewer‚Äù skin to get a healthy amount of nutrients and moisture
Vitamin C- helps your skin hold more moisture and gives it a healthy glow (brightens)
Vitamin B5- helps to keep skin soft and healthy, but also provides a smoother look
All products at InstaNatural are made in the USA and never animal tested

Application- The product works best when applied twice a day, just like a facial skincare regimen. You apply the cream to skin that is clean and dry. You simply pump out the amount needed and apply to your thighs, stomach, legs, and anywhere you wish to address! Use a healthy amount of motion to make sure the cream penetrates and the caffeine hits those targeted areas. I went with a deep massage and allowed the cream to fully dry before dressing.

What to Expect- Cellulite is one of those attributes you hear everyone has but that does not make you love it, or much less accept it. While over-the-counter products will not fully remove the appearance of the skin, it certainly can diminish it. I‚Äôm all for zapping it any way I can and InstaNatural‚Äôs Cellulite cream does aid with this pesky little problem. Thank the healthy amount of Caffeine in the product because it not only minimizes the appearance but provides you with instant results. You get to see a difference on the first day but it does not stop there. The cream has a nice amount of moisturizers like Shea Butter and Cocoa Butter, which penetrate and soften the appearance of the cellulite and surrounding skin. Then comes the Retinol punch that helps in not only repairing but rejuvenation, and by this I mean, it helps the ‚Äúturn-over‚Äù process of shedding our ‚Äúdamaged‚Äù looking skin quicker. The Retinol helps produce a less marked skin in less time than if not used! The cellulite/dimple mark will still be present but with continual use, you can achieve a minimizing look and the finer lines will be less visible, along with the dimples. I found the cream to not only help moisturize and produce softer and a more supple skin‚Äôs surface, but it also produced a more firmer appearance that was visible to the eye and touch. I am all for the instant results and especially as the days get warmer and the bikini is due to come out!

I received the above product(s) free of charge from InstaNatural. I am not obligated to provide a positive or favorable review, just my honest opinion. My review is based on my experience with the product and/or brand, which may differ from yours.
title: InstaNatural: Cellulite Cream Review

review_text:
Back in the golden oldie days B.C. (Before COVID-19), I wouldn‚Äôt have known the difference between a barber‚Äôs cape and a bullfighter‚Äôs cape. But today, home hair cutting is now the norm, and a barber‚Äôs cape is practically a necessity.

This SmoTecQ one does the job with little drama. Measuring an adult-sized 57 by 63 inches, it has an elasticized neckband with two thin but sturdy metal clasps that can adjust to fit tightly around any size neck. The fabric in the back tended to gape open a little when I tested it, and it‚Äôs much shorter in the back than in the front, but overall it does a good job at what it‚Äôs intended to do. Hair doesn‚Äôt stick to it too badly, so it‚Äôs relatively easy to wipe clean after use. Folding it up to try to put it neatly back into its plastic storage bag was a challenge.

That‚Äôs not to say that hair still doesn‚Äôt go all over the floor, though, and that‚Äôs why my amateur haircuts, whether I‚Äôm getting them or giving them, take place on one of my outdoor patios.

Based on my zero knowledge of what makes a good one or a bad one, I have to rate this barber‚Äôs cape at a middle-of-the-road three stars. I wish I didn‚Äôt need one at all, but in the current reality, it‚Äôs a must-have item, and this one seems to do the job.
title: A Necessity for Home Hair Cutting

review_text:
This product has everything I like. A likeable backstory about the founders, produced in small hand crafted patches, and delivers the quality results that it promises.

I wear my hair short (buzzed on the sides) with about 3-4 inches on top, which I style differently depending on the day. I usually like it combed to the side, and pushed back, but with volume to give it a nice swoop. My hair is fine, but a lot of it.

I‚Äôve never been a fan of pomade in the past because I find it doesn‚Äôt hold it‚Äôs shape and is too shiny. However, this pomade provides a natural looking shine, while holding my hair in my preferred style. The pomade itself is very light and thin. I didn‚Äôt think it would work when applying, but within seconds it began to form my hair into my go-to style. It dries to a ‚Äútacky‚Äù feel, which allows you to readjust throughout the day, but wouldn‚Äôt feel comfortable to run your fingers through it. After applying, the product easily washed off my hands, and out of my hair at the end of the day.

The scent is good but not overwhelming. It has the typical ‚Äúmasculine‚Äù scent that you will find in deodorants, body wash, shaving cream, etc. for men. The scent lingers till you wash it out.

Overall, I will definitely be using up this entire jar.
title: I became an immediate fan

review_text:
We do not get out a lot, but I do go to a lot of doctors' appointments and hospitals and there is nothing I hate more than hospital soap. It is abrasive and it has a scent that is so distinct and it sticks with you for hours and hours after you have washed your hands. I loathe hospital soap.

These little soap sheets are simply amazing. Not only do they pack light - I can stick one little tin in my bag and it takes up almost no space at all, but the sheets themselves are tiny. The sheets dissolve nearly instantly in water, lather perfectly and the smell so nice. They are like a little bathroom oasis at the doctor or hospital. The scent does not linger though, so please do not be worried about smelling like ylang ylang for hours on end.

My hands always feel clean when I leave the bathroom and I have even used a sheet to wet a paper towel and wipe my face off.
title: A Lovely Change From Hospital Soap

review_text:
This is a very nice mascara. It does come however in a cheaper looking container I think, at least to me the cartoonish container looks cheaper. I didn't think it really added that much volume to my lashes as much as it actually lengthened them which is fine. I do believe you can build this up to more thickness but then you would get that spidery look that I do not care for.

The wand is a nice thin wand that helps not making a mess all over. The bristles are shorter and make it very easy to use. The mascara is smudge proof. I had it on for a solid 16 hours and it did not budge until I used a makeup remover and it came off very easy at that point.

This is a nice mascara and it will cost you $18. I have some others that perform similarly that are cheaper than this one though so it is a bit overpriced in my eyes.

review_text:
(Ingredients list is at the bottom of this review.)

I am really loving the TINAZANA Vegan Bakuchiol Comforting Cream (2.7oz / 80ml). Only 9 ingredients. It is so good. Truly comforting and non-irritating. Even when my skin is already in an irritated state.

This is a beautifully thick, rich, white moisturizing cream. Yet, somehow it feels decently lightweight and comfortable on the face and neck. Not lightweight like a gel cream, by any means. But comfortable. This cream glides onto the face and neck smoothly, and it soaks into the skin quickly; But it doesn't disappear. It leaves a lasting, soothing, comforting layer of moisture and hydration on the surface of the skin. It helps to lock-in the moisture and hydration from the previous steps in my skincare routine, and leave my skin feeling so lovely and comfortable.

The scent is extremely slight. It is herbal, but it's almost undetectable, unless you're really seeking after the scent.

The packaging is a beautiful yellow glass jar with a beige twist-off lid. It feels very nice in the hand, and the cream feels luxurious on the face. Much more expensive than it is. The 80ml size is excellent for the price.

The addition of gentle, anti-aging Bakuchiol is also a big win with zero irritation. Plus, Shea Butter for maximum moisture. I layer gentle, hydrating, soothing, calming toners and serums underneath this cream, and I get excellent glowy, dewy results.

I use this cream day and night, as I have dry, sensitive skin. I imagine many skin types might like this for day or night, especially during colder months.

If you have sensitive skin, and you cannot use most skincare products (like me), this is likely going to be for you.

Overall, I'm highly impressed. Why did it take me so long to find this? This cream is so beautifully simple. It's truly an amazing find for someone like me, who struggles with sensitive skin. I will definitely repurchase, and I'm looking forward to trying more simple, gentle products from Tinazana.

I highly recommend this cream to anyone and everyone.

INGREDIENTS:

Water, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea) Butter, Butylene Glycol, 1,2-Hexanediol, Polysilicone-34, Isononyl Isononanoate, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Ethyhexylglycerin, Bakuchiol.
title: Beautiful, Gentle Cream - So Simple & So Nice - Great For Dry Skin & Sensitive Skin

review_text:
At first, I was excited to get this micro-needling device, but then I started to look into micro needling. Dermatologists said to take Vitamin C 2 for weeks before use, and avoid sunlight; avoid makeup; your skin may peel afterward. So, I was afraid to try it out. It turns out, that using this is not painful at all. But when used on my forehead, it looks like it has more pores. So, I decided to start taking vitamins, and planned out when to try this out, but I avoided trying it out before times when I planned to expose it to sunlight, along with one week before my (wife‚Äôs) period.

Finally, I had the right time to try it out, and it had no obvious side effects...no pain, no skin flushing, no damage, no problems with sunlight or wearing makeup. Because this is a device made for home use, it is much more mild than professional devices. You may be able to use this every other day.

The device is light weight, and rechargeable, but comes with batteries, so you don‚Äôt have to charge before use; this makes it easy to bring on travel. I wish I had tried it much earlier.

The head is supposed to be replaced every three months at a current cost of $35. You are supposed to use a new cleaning pad before every use, and it came with 5 pads; the replacement skin prep pads are $35 for 30 pads which will last you two months, using it two to three times a week, which is what the manufacturer recommends. The minimum monthly cost of supplies is about $38 per month. You also need to have isopropyl (rubbing) alcohol to use with the provided spray bottle to sanitize the micro-needling head.

I would recommend using sun screen after use, to protect your skin.

After the first few uses, I haven‚Äôt seen much effect, but my husband thinks my face‚Äôs skin looks better.
title: Don‚Äôt Be Afraid, Just Give it a Try!

review_text:
This is a beginner set, but it's not looking to help you-- No instructions.

Lucky for me--This isn't my first gel kit.

At first when I opened the box I liked how much they had to offer creatively. Some kits try to force a look, but this one was open to play with. Maybe not the best idea for a beginner kit- but I enjoyed that.

First the good:
I like this type of lamp when I'm doing gel- it's easy together both my hands in to hold the nail down when I first start, then I usually pick up the light and rotate it to get a full cure. Yes I have to restart the lamp a few times, but this isn't an expensive lamp so I don't mind.

I liked the little box they came in- sure it's cheep, but it was a nice tough to have (almost) everything in once place.

Then the annoying:

There are a lot of odd little problems, like the Gel itself, two are jelly clear and one is opaque. Opaque gel takes a little longer to cure because the light works a bit harder to travel though the nail. It would have been helpful if they mentioned that, OR only gave you one type of gel-so it doesn't confuse you-- but they didn't.

The nail forms were a bad fir for my hand. Thats just an unlucky break- all hands are diffrent- so im not including that in my rating, just something to mention in case they don't work for you too.

The colors were a little annoying to use, no color indicator on the bottle. this is common with cheeper sets, but I thought I'd mention it anyway- It can make doing your nails just a little bothersome.

The ugly-
they don't include slip solution-I ended up using my own from my nail kit, so I didn't have any problems, but that's a huge mistake on their part-- if you're just starting out you'll think gel nails are a sticky mess. Slip solution makes them manageable.

Overall- I feel like there are better kits that will give you a cleaner start over this one--

I hope this review was helpful!
title: I wouldn't start with this--

review_text: I couldn't use this product at all. Any time I tried to apply to my under eye it would burn really badly. I would have to immediately wipe it off. I always used a clean face when I applied this and it still burned.

review_text:
What's that saying about necessity being the mother of invention? Well here we are in a pandemic wearing face masks. Someone came up with the idea of a head band with buttons to hold the mask mask in place.

This is a thin material. Think very thin t shirt type material. The headband measures about 18 inches and just over 3 inches wide. I like the material for a headband. However, its use as a mask holder is iffy. Many people complain that the elastic that holds the masks in place makes their ears pop out. That is definitely true of some masks. They can also be wearying on the ears, having that elastic against your ears all day, so this headband is a great concept.
I put the headband on and as I stretched it over my head, I heard a pop, so some stitching gave somewhere.

I attached two types of masks, one at a time. First, it was a bit fiddly to get the elastic over the button. Once it just sprang off.

One mask using the buttons fit well. Another did not. The latter mask opened up on the sides.

I would hesitate to wear this out thinking that everything would stay put for hours. I like the headband as a headband. It's nice material. A sort of light grey merle, but if you are looking at this for long-term safety, I would say no.
title: Nifty idea but I'd worry about it holding mask in place

review_text:
La La Leaf Guayaquil Hemp Lotion feels cooling and calming to my dry, sensitive skin. It feels light, absorbs quickly and moisturizes my skin fairly well. This lotion leaves my hands and skin soft, silky and comfortable. I don‚Äôt feel my dry skin gets as much hydration as I get with my favorite premium body butters and creams, but those are heavier products so I don‚Äôt expect as much from a lotion.

When applied after my shower, I get about 8 hours of hydration. That‚Äôs pretty good, though not the 24 hours claimed on the site. I do have dry skin and find this lotion hydrates better than most lotions. I‚Äôve occasionally found one that gives me longer lasting hydration, but it‚Äôs uncommon. Excipial keeps my dry skin comfortable and itch free more like 12 hours but has chemicals such as parabens, while Guayaquil Hemp Lotion emphasizes organic and natural ingredients (but does have Phenoxyethanol).

Guayaquil Hemp Lotion feels gentle and doesn‚Äôt irritate my sensitive skin at all. It doesn‚Äôt list chemical fragrance and is labeled fragrance free, which is a big plus as some fragrances trigger sensitivities for me. But it still may have fragrance. I smell a faint non offensive scent and don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs from added ‚Äúessential oil‚Äù (last ingredient) or just the natural scent of the natural ingredients.

Guayaquil Hemp Lotion has 250 mg of CBD (THC free), which is still being studied but ‚Äúmay‚Äù hydrate dry skin and help inflammation. The ingredients look good but this lotion does have moderately risky (per EWG) Phenoxyethanol in the top ten ingredients and drying alcohol in the bottom 5. I like this lotion a lot as it feels pleasing to my sensitive skin, hydrates my dry skin pretty well, is 84% organic and barely has a scent. 4.5 stars. Made in USA. Vegan.

Ingredients: Organic Aloe Leaf Juice, Organic Coconut Oil, Glycerin, Stearic Acid, Emulsifying Wax, Witch Hazel Water, Vitamin E, Sunflower Seed Oil, Phenoxyethanol, Organic Hemp Seed Oil, Rose Flower Water, CBD, Organic White Willow Bark Extract, Organic Rosemary Leaf Extract, Organic Neem Seed Oil, Organic Alcohol, Xanthan Gum, Tetrasodium Glutamate Diacetate, Essential Oil
title: Gentle On Sensitive Skin, Good Hydration But Not 24 Hours, Natural/Organic Emphasis (4.5 Stars)

review_text:
I have tried a few products by this line by Laloirelle. This Luminous Face oil comes in a dark glass dropper bottle like a lot of facial oils do. It is not cheap at almost $100 to be honest. When you use this you will need about a drop for each side of your face, so a little does go a long way, but this is still not an inexpensive product so handle this as such.

This particular one is filled with pomegranate oil, cacao oil infused with white peony root, marigold flower and lotus leaf. This particular blend is supposed to be brightening, soothing, regenerating, purifying and reduce the appearance of dullness. When you use this you will notice this oil definitely has a fragrance to it that is reminiscent of an essential oil. They recommend to use it morning and night, however in my experience when you use this it does absorb fairly quickly. It does leave an oily residue on your skin though. If you wear makeup and especially right now with wearing masks, I would not recommend applying this facial oil in the morning. For a makeup application that could cause trouble and I found with facial oils I sweat heavily when wearing masks.

It provided some moisture but I didn‚Äôt really see a brightening effect to be honest, however I did feel that my skin felt oily which is why I prefer using this in the evening. In the morning my skin felt nicely moisturized. Is this really worth the price? In my eyes not really since I have other brighteners that do the same thing and cost a fraction of this oil while not making my face greasy.
title: Underwhelmed - didn't work for me

review_text:
I love the zingy, fragrant scent of the shampoo. It feels relatively unisex, and doesn't leave a lot of fragrance lingering behind after you rinse it out. I followed up with a peppermint conditioner from the natural food store, and really enjoyed the lovely cooling summer pick me up for my hair.

The shampoo is not overly stripping, but definitely leans more towards really getting things clean rather than being overly moisturizing. I found that I could use it about three times a week on my long hair, and then needed to do co-washing or something more moisturizing in between. I really like the shampoo and appreciate having something more herbal like this in my regimen.

review_text: Super nice! Easy to use and removes makeup efficiently. Just put a little on a cotton ball and wipes right off. I used this for my eyeshadow, liner and mascara. Does the job! And I have sensitive skin and this has not caused any problems!
title: Gets the job done!

review_text:
The first time I used the Sia Botanics Vitamin C Face Wash I wasn't super impressed, but there was something about it that I liked so I kept using it on a daily basis. It didn't take me long to realize that I really, really loved this face wash.

It arrives in a relatively small 4-ounce bottle. The face wash includes 20% Vitamin C along with Organic Aloe Vera, MSM, and Organic Rose Hip Oil. It utilizes the actual lemon peel, a process that is noted to contain 5-10 times more vitamins than the lemon juice. The wash is designed to naturally exfoliate, remove blackheads, and naturally lighten the skin.

While the 4-ounce bottle seems quite small, it takes very little to do the job. The wash comes out as a sort of milky lotion that lathers lightly yet effectively. The lemon peel contains citric and phytic acids and I felt that sort of acidic quality on my face, but it was lighter than a typical exfoliant. It left my skin cleaner, but in a healthy way rather than in a glowing way.

This is designed to be a daily face wash. I'm not completely sure I'd use it on a daily basis given its price point, but I have to admit it feels so natural and has been so effective that I may be convinced otherwise by the time this first bottle is actually done. I love the way that it's making my face look and feel and I'm super pleased with the healthier appearance.

For me, this has turned out to be rather gentle giant of a face wash. It's light yet super effective and isn't particularly showy but accomplishes quite a bit in terms of facial health and appearance.
title: Daily Face Wash is Light, Super Effective

review_text:
The makeup remover pads are decently thick and fluffy, and are soft on the skin while still cleaning. I don't recommend using just water for the removal of makeup, regardless of what the product claims. These will only clean the surface. You need something that will really cut through the makeup and cleanse everything that has worked its way into your pores. But with a cleanser, these will be effective.

The size of the pads are smaller than they are made to look online online. That's not really an issue, but be aware.

The headband is made of a towel-like material, and it is plenty big enough to wrap around anyone's head and not be tight. I like it.

The only issue I have with this set is the price for what you get. Three little pads, a headband, and a flimsy laundry bag don't quite seem worth the current listed price of $19.

Otherwise, nice.
title: A nice little set

review_text: This lipsticks colors looks good, They are cheap and have an off scent to them. and tried testing those lipsticks but after hour I felt irritation so I don't suggest for everyone, Make sure before use.
title: Okay!

review_text: At the current price of $48, this is insanely expensive. Yes the brush is a beautiful blue, with a fantastic gloss, and looks great, feels nice in my hands, and brushes my fine short to medium curly hair well. However, the brush stinks to high heaven and reminds me of the smell of burning rubber tires. Unfortunately, I cannot use this in this condition because I am extremely sensitive to offensive odors.
title: Beautiful brush but it stinks like rubber tires; YUCK; price is INSANE

review_text: Fresh strawberry scent. Feels like velvet on face. Skin feels smooth and hydrated.
title: Perfection

review_text: Love these cleansing pads. I typically use fragrance free body oil to remove eye makeup, but was happy to see same thing in a pad. I was worried it would irritate the eyes, but it didn't! I used one pad for both eyes to remove waterproof mascara and eyeliner. No irritation and it took everything off! Definitely recommend!
title: Removes stubborn makeup, even waterproof mascara!

review_text: These are fun and great for a quick touch up, but compared to the nicer brands these really dry out my lips.
title: Cute, but they dry out my lips

review_text: I have a tendency to develop frequent sinus headaches, so I ordered this mask to help the headaches that develop in my sinus region and behind my eyes. This works GREAT. It's easy to use- just plug and go. It heats quickly, retains the heat, and isn't too hot to get uncomfortable. It is the perfect weight and helps so much with pain relief. It feels like it will last for awhile and has already helped take the edge off several really bad headaches and eye aches. Although this may not have been designed as a migraine relief aid, it is a true lifesaver.
title: An AMAZING heating pad

review_text:
This smells good, very much like spring break in Cancun or summers at the beach. The lotion is very light weight almost liquid thin so it comes out pretty easily from the bottle. It is absorbed rather quickly in the skin but for several minutes afterwards my skin felt like it was tacky. After 5 to 10 minuets that went away. Not a big issue when I am taking my time getting ready but not something I want to wait for when I am on a limited time window getting ready for work.

Overall, smells good and does somewhat moisturize your skin but doesn't last throughout the day.
title: slightly tacky feeling on skin after use

review_text:
This is a nice big bottle of conditioner. It detangles my hair and makes it soft and not frizzy. I love the peppermint aroma. It's refreshing and energizing. The list of ingredients includes lots of natural oils, like Argan, tea tree , rosemary
and even broccoli seed oil !
title: Minty!

review_text: Works as well as any nail polish remover I‚Äôve used.  It quickly and easily removed regular nail polish, the at home lightless gel polish took a bit longer.  My problem I have with the product is that it is not sealed under the cap.  I know some brands aren‚Äôt and that‚Äôs probably fine in a store (though I still prefer sealed in this day and age) but the screw cap was just taped to keep it from unscrewing in travel.  Taping worked fine but some still leaked and the box smelled of nail polish remover.  Also, the price isn‚Äôt exactly great, I can get regular nail polish remover at the dollar store.
title: it‚Äôs plain old nail polish remover

review_text:
Supremely soft. Seriously, the first thing you will notice is how incredibly soft these are. Really good quality, and attractive. I immediately recommend them, haha. Has a good stretch, fits my large head without feeling irritating (kinda forget it is on), and it stays in place. What is this sorcery?

If I experience anything else while wearing these, I will come back to update. My initial and immediate impression was just so favorable that I had to jump on a review to say so.

Currently $3.99 for a set of two. Good deal
title: so incredibly soft, stays in place, attractive, high quality, I AM IMPRESSED

review_text: I am in love with these lashes!  The Cat Eye is my favorite lash shape and these did not disappoint.
title: Cat Eye!

review_text:
Oz products are great. This is my 5th one. This mask really hydrates your skin, feeling plumper with less visable wrinkles. I use it a couple times a week. I use it for 30 minutes since my skin is more dry and I am slightly older. Then just rinse off. Then I apply serum and moisturizer. After using your skin feels so refreshing like after a good night's rest. It's nice to pamper yourself without the costs of a spa. I did receive this prodoct
complimentary to give my honest and unbiased opinion.
title: Oz products are great. This is my 5th one

review_text: A very nice conditioner. It leaves my hair (colored, wavy, and tending toward dryness and tangling) soft and smoother. I like the way it feels afterwards, although I wouldn't use it everyday--once or twice a week seems best. I like the way it smells. All in all, a good product, at least for hair like mine.
title: Good conditioner that left my hair softer, more manageable and feeling good

review_text: Usually my eye cream is enough to keep my under eyes happy, but sometimes they need a little extra. These gels do the trick perfectly. I usually put them on after I wash my face and I do a sheet mask on the rest of my face over the top of these so everything comes out nice and smooth and hydrated. They are packed with goodness and that sinks right into your skin.
title: Easy to apply, hydrated skin

review_text:
We discovered Essie nail polish a while ago and it quickly became my partners favorite. But that was the Gel Couture line which has been known to stand up to entire canoe trips into Minnesota's Boundary Waters. This is truly good nail polish, but as she says, "this is more for people who do their nails daily or at least don't expect it to last through a hike."

We did like the Let it Glow Pink color, and we like the brand, but they set their own bar high. This is definitely a good polish, just their other line is better.
title: A Very Good Polish, But we like Essie's Gel Couture Line even better!

review_text: This product is four pumice stone callus removers.  I tried this product out on my feet, and the product works great.  These pumice stones are double sided.  One side is white.  The other sides of the four stones are: one is blue, one is pink, one is yellow, and one is green.
title: Great Product

review_text: First off, all these new lash growth serums seem to work if you use them consistently, as does this one by Veta. However, I was not impressed with the container and/or applicator. It‚Äôs a small tube similar to a thin mascara bottle and it has a black button on top to release the serum. The tip is like a thick wax that gets covered with the serum but it‚Äôs difficult to use on the subtle lash line or eyes in general. I prefer the wand versions to apply the serum because they are simple and fast and easier to apply. This lash and brow pen does work though and only takes about two weeks to see a difference.
title: Works With Time And Patience

review_text: The product is okay. I didn‚Äôt feel these masks were better than other masks that I‚Äôve used before. Also, the masks are not made in USA. They are made in Taiwan. Cool advertisement but, it‚Äôs 3 masks for $18. It‚Äôs a pass for me.
title: Overpriced.

review_text: I‚Äôve read that a silk bonnet can help protect curls during sleep so I wanted to see if it would work for me. I like my curls to last a few days since it takes me an hour to curl my hair. I‚Äôm pleased to say that this bonnet really does preserve the actual curl in my hair. The inside is a satin material like the outside and the hair just slips around and doesn‚Äôt tug or pull. Easy to put on, has an adjustable elastic strap. Combined with my silk pillows, this is a dream combination.
title: So soft!

review_text: An amazing amount of nail art supplies for the price. This set included both christmas and halloween nail fooils in a array of styles. I used the foils in the jar and the ones applied with foil glue. The glue supplied was perfect for applying the foils. after drying for 60 seconds under the uv lamp I was able to attach the foils and this is the best nail glue that I have ever tried. After rubbing the pattern down with a cuticle pusher the pattern stays down and with the spacing even if part of it does not come off you are able to work with the design to cover it up. I love this set. It would make a perfect addition for anyone who loves nail design kits. So many cute designs to choose from and it comes with nail liner tape, brushes and dotters to create what ever design you have in mind.
title: Must have for fall/winter holiday design

review_text: Easy to use and colors are super vibrant. Lasts about 2 weeks and comes off with nail drill. Love the variety of colors and highly recommend this for any at home nail diy!
title: Perfect for winter and holidays

review_text:
Very good mask. I have super sensitive skin and I was worried using this mask. In the past I have burned my face and irritated my skin really bad.

This product went on smooth and it dried evenly on my face. I was able to hold on keep this product on my face for the allotted amount of time given in the directions.

My pores felt really good after and my face felt new. New to me is a good thing because I am constantly around things that keep my face sweaty and dirty.

This prosecutor is pretty expensive so I will really have to judge the results versus how much it costs if I am going to buy it again.
title: Very nice on my sensitive skin.

review_text: This peel and reveal lip color works pretty well. It was easy to apply, I had no issues with it cracking or coming up, and reminds me more so of a stain. The downside that I found with this lip color is the actual color itself. It seems like you can only select colors that are either super pink, or super red. I tend to favor more natural and neutral lip tones. Perhaps because the way the product is made and works you cant do a neutral lip color but I'm not a huge fan of the pink.
title: Works Well

review_text: This brush is perfect. I did a full overlay Acrylic set and they were perfect. Although I prefer this particular brush for nail due the smaller size. It still works great for doing artificial nail sets.
title: Great brush! It‚Äôs a small size.

review_text: It doesn't keep my baby hairs down for too long. I wish it had a stronger hold
title: It is okay

review_text: I will probably give them to the girl. She is big in the winged liner and she does a great job. To add the eyelashes will be a snap for her. I would most likely need someone to assist me. Old age does not make it easier doing special things like lashes and liners.
title: I am not sure I want to try this

review_text: Majestic Pure is one of my favorite brands. They offer a money back guarantee & offer quality products. This Retinol Moisturizer Cream is another winner. You just need a bit & it feels so silky & smooth & so does your skin. There is no oily, greasy feel & didn't cause me any burning or redness.  It was refreshing & the added moisturizer kept the Retinol from drying out my skin. I did receive this cream at a reduced cost for an honest opinion. Thank You!
title: Majestic Pure is one of my favorite brands. They offer a money back guarantee & ...

review_text: These two spray bottles are fairly decent for light to medium usage. They are glass, but not thick and hefty as you might expect. They feel like plastic even though they aren't. If dropped, these things are going to shatter. The internal spray tubes are plenty long enough to reach every bit of liquid in the bottle and wide enough to pull up good amounts of fluid. There's no excessive spraying because the amount discharged is so little. We've not had any trouble with the nozzles (going from on to off, clogging up, shooting the liquid off at a weird angle, etc). I don't recommend these for heavy duty work or for use in an area where they are likely to be knocked off to the floor.
title: Not heavy duty glass

review_text: It‚Äôs a regular comb lol nothing really to say about it. The price doesn‚Äôt fit the product but other than that it‚Äôs normal
title: Regular

review_text:
[[VIDEOID:f3800eaac90f72192ba79de85cf049ce]] This comes very well packaged. Protected on a lot of bubble wrap. With how often eyeshadow palettes come with broken shadows, I always appreciate when one comes with extra care taken to protect it! The palette has cardboard packaging. There‚Äôs an outer sleeve cover. It has the exact same look on the front and back on the outer sleeve cover as it does on the outer packaging of the palette. The shade names are found on the back of the palette and are also labeled under each shade inside the palette, which I like. A lot of affordable palettes, they don‚Äôt have the shade names inside, which is usually fine with me because it‚Äôs so affordable and they have to cut costs somewhere. So, when the shade names are included inside the palette on affordable palettes, I always appreciate it. There‚Äôs also a big mirror that is just a little smaller than the lid. Again, a lot of affordable palettes don‚Äôt have mirrors, which is another way to cut costs for the companies to make the palette a cheaper price. Again, not something I mind since it‚Äôs affordable. So, again, when I see mirrors in affordable palettes, I appreciate it. There‚Äôs also a removable plastic sheet cover over the shades inside the palette.

The shades are all beautiful. (See photos of swatches).

The mattes have good pigment, feel smooth, not chalky at all. Brushes pick them up well and they apply on the eyes nicely. A few shades need built up a little more, but not too much where I get annoyed üòÇ

The shimmers/metallics are smooth, pigmented, and pretty shimmery. A brush picks them up easily, and they apply easily and look beautiful using fingers or brushes.

There‚Äôs 2 pressed glitters. 1 of them isn‚Äôt small circular kind of glitters. It‚Äôs small stars. I don‚Äôt really love when pressed glitters are in a palette. I have a love hate relationship with glitter. Love the look of it, hate how it gets EVERYWHERE, you‚Äôre finding glitter particles everywhere for a while after you use it. Plus, they aren‚Äôt safe for the eyes. Get some in the eye and you can scratch your cornea! But, smaller glitter particles aren‚Äôt too bad in my opinion. However, with the one in this palette that has stars, those would be waaaaaay more risky than smaller circular like glitter particles. The stars are bigger and have extremely pointy edges. Plus, it‚Äôs hard to pick up with your finger. So, I really don‚Äôt like that pressed glitter. The other pressed glitter is made up of tiny particles. It picks up easily, sticks pretty good on its own, great with a wet base like concealer or glitter glue. So, I don‚Äôt like that 2 shades are pressed glitters, but the palette is so affordable, 2 I don‚Äôt like and probably won‚Äôt use out of the 18 isn‚Äôt so bad to me.

There‚Äôs 1 shade that is a concealer shade. It‚Äôs a cream kind of concealer. I fear it would dry out, so I‚Äôll be putting a piece of tape over it, with the edge bent over together to leave a little tab to pull it up if I want to use it (I did this with my Huda New Nude palette and the concealer shade hasn‚Äôt dried up). The shade is pretty thin and waxy feeling. I don‚Äôt feel I‚Äôll ever really use it, but just in case figure I‚Äôd keep it from drying out.

This is a dupe for Hudas New Nude palette (see swatch photos comparing the 2).
- They even have the shades named the exact same as the shades in Hudas palette, except one that is named ‚ÄúSpanked‚Äù in Huda is named ‚ÄúSpaked‚Äù in this palette and one that is named ‚ÄúLove Bite‚Äù in Huda is names ‚ÄúEITE‚Äù in this palette ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è üòÇ (see photos to see both palettes together).
- All of the shades and their placement in this palette correspond exactly to the shades and their placement in Hudas palette, except the shades ‚ÄúSpanked‚Äù and ‚ÄúLove Bite,‚Äù and ‚ÄúConcealed‚Äù and ‚ÄúPlay.‚Äù In both palettes, ‚ÄúSpanked‚Äù and ‚ÄúLove Bite‚Äù are in the first row, the last 2. But, in this palette it‚Äôs, ‚ÄúSpaked‚Äù and ‚ÄúLove Bite‚Äù and in the Huda palette it‚Äôs ‚ÄúLove Bite‚Äù and ‚ÄúSpanked.‚Äù In the Huda palette, ‚ÄúConcealed‚Äù is the concealer shade and ‚ÄúPlay‚Äù is a light peach matte shade. In this palette ‚ÄúConcealed‚Äù is a nude type shade, that has a little peachy color to it and ‚ÄúPlay‚Äù is the concealer shade. So, in the Huda palette there‚Äôs a light peach matte shade called ‚ÄúPlay‚Äù that this palette does not have (this palette has a nude with a slight peach tint to it).
- Other than that, the shades are pretty spot on. In the Huda palette, the metallics feel just a little creamier, but not by much. In this palette they feel really smooth, not chunky at all. As you can see in the swatches, the metallic shades aren‚Äôt quite as metallic as they are in the Huda palette, but they are pretty darn close. The colors of all the shades are also pretty darn close. I‚Äôd say the shade that‚Äôs most off, other than the light peach matte shade not being a full on peach shade and more of a nude shade with a peach tint in this palette, the other shade that‚Äôs the most off is ‚ÄúKinky.‚Äù In the Huda palette it‚Äôs a deeper, richer red. In this palette it‚Äôs more of a burnt orange type red or rust kind of red. You can see in the swatches. Then, the ‚ÄúConcealed‚Äù shade in the Huda palette, the corresponding shade in this palette is ‚ÄúPlay.‚Äù The Huda one is creamier, and has more color. As I said before, the one in this palette is thinner and waxy feeling. The pressed glitters - ‚ÄúExcite‚Äù is made of small, red glitter particles in both palettes. The Huda one is smoother feeling, not so rough feeling. ‚ÄúInfatuated‚Äù in this palette is totally different than Hudas, it‚Äôs silver and stars, not red with small glitter particles.

Overall, I think this is a great palette. Good packaging, a nice mirror inside. The shades perform well. The mattes are smooth and blend easily and have good pigment. The metallic shades are smooth and pigmented and look beautiful. If you were looking for a nude/pink palette, this is a great choice! If you have been wanting the Huda palette but didn‚Äôt like the cost of it, this is a great choice instead. The colors are pretty spot on, the differences are slight where once they‚Äôre on the eye, it wouldn‚Äôt be too noticeable. Other than the star pressed glitter and the nude shade with some peach in it. This palette would definitely give you the same looks. I really do think it‚Äôd a great affordable palette!
title: Great Palette! Great Dupe!

review_text: This is an excellent natural body wash that is perfect for anyone that has sensitive skin. I have been using this product for several weeks now and I am very surprised at how soft and moisturized my skin feels. I also used it as a conditioner for my hair and was shocked at how soft and revitalized my skin felt. The ingredients in this body wash prompted me to use this product on my toddler and I am happy to state that the results were excellent. The body wash left my daughters skin soft and not irritated, which has occurred in the past with popular body washes. This product is made up of Tea Tree Oil, Coconut Oil and Argan Oil. I am not sure if anyone knows this, but another name for Tea Tree Oil is melaleuca. Melaleuca is known to kill bacteria, fungus and viruses. This is a very powerful anti-bacterial body wash that is absolutely worth the price.
title: Very effective Body Wash

review_text: Love this cute 12in bob! Perfect for everyday use or in between installs to throw on and go. The hair is very soft, healthy and holds a style very nicely. The wig cap, I would say, fits an average size range  but does have an adjustable strap inside the cap to make it tighter if need be. The ca also has sewn in combs, two on each side and one in back, to help secure the wig to your head. The lace is very soft and transparent, I think it could melt in to almost every skin tone. The hairline could use a little plucking for a more natural look, as well as the part. The knots on the hair line and part also need to be bleached to be less visible. Other than those two small things I love this wig and absolutely recommend it.
title: HAIR IS SOFT AND HEALTHY

review_text: This hair does not tangle much at all! It was great for making small box braids. I sealed the ends with boiling water which worked just fine. It took 2 rounds of dipping my hair in the water to seal them though. The hair is separated into bundles and separated with twist ties. I like the twist ties better than bundles that are separated with hair ties. The twist ties were easier to get off without tangling the hair. I used olive oil, edge control, and hair gel infused with castor oil to braid my hair. All of the products worked well with the hair. I would definitely get this again.
title: Great braiding hair!

review_text: The clips are all pretty big - they look like they appear on the website.  They are pretty and will hold your hair tight enough to stay in without falling out.  There are a lot of pearls on each barrette - I'm not so sure just how long those pearls will stay on the clips with lots of use.  I'm not really sure if my little girls will like them when they find them in their Christmas stockings or not because they are so big, but we'll see.
title: Very Nice - but I'm not so sure just how long those "pearls" will stay attached.

review_text: So, to try this out, I followed the directions, opened the LED part and removed the blue battery saver paper. Then I reassembled, making sure that the batteries were in the correct position. Then, I could not get the thing to turn on. I tried in different parts of my face, holding it there and nothing happened.
title: Does a red LED light really make a difference

review_text: This is the prettiest mascara I've ever used in terms of the box and the tube itself, which replicates the box perfectly. Happily, the mascara works well, too. The wand is thick and average is design and width, and it does a good job separating your lashes. The fibers really do add length, and I had no problems with them flaking off into my eyes, a problem I've had with a few other brands that offer similar claims to this brand. It stayed on all day and washed off easily with my normal facial soap. I'm not thrilled it's made in China, as their quality standards have been suspect in some other products, but I haven't had any problems with this mascara.
title: Good mascara in lovely packaging

review_text: This is a 2 ounce bottle of argan oil that is commonly used for body care, either by itself or in combination with other ingredients. The bottle top is OK for dispensing the oil though it would have been better to have a special dropper top. This is a nourishing oil that is worth trying if you want a natural skin care aid.
title: Pure argan oil, good for hair and skin

review_text: Thick nail files. Very high end quality. Got plenty for the price. Work as expected, even better.
title: Great quality nail file

review_text: This is one of the best masks I've used in a while! It was slightly bigger than some, but you can easily fold over to fit. Holes for eyes and mouth were perfect size, and fits well over the nose! No unpleasant fragrance and lots of essence. The best part is that it doesn't leave your skin feeling even 1% sticky after taking it off! Great quantity for the price as well...definitely recommend!
title: One of the best!

review_text: These hairbands are inexpensive and do look cheap. I bought them for skin care routine, and they did their job well, no loose hair on my face during my skin routine. But you will be unhappy if you want to wear them all day long. The plastic is soft and the hairband cannot stay in place.
title: Not for all day wear

review_text: So handy to use while applying my makeup instead of tying my hair back in a pony tail! I love them! Super soft and comfy too. Comes with all the colors as well.
title: Prefect for applying make up or washing my face

review_text: I do not think I will continue to use this gadget. For one, like others have said, it is larger than it appears. It is kind of hard to get into my mouth and biting it is not really ergonomic. I followed the directions in the description and boiled it so that when I bit down, the clear bits became an impression of my teeth. However, I did not find that to be much help later on. I used this a couple of times and while I did find my jaw feeling sore afterwards, I do not feel comfortable using it for the long term. My jaw is not in good alignment (something I need surgery for but can't afford) so I got this with hopes that it could help support my jaw and keep it from getting worse. I also have a hard time with jaw discomfort from teeth grinding and my dentist said that exercises can help alleviate that issue. Due to the large size and ill-fit, I fear that it could do more damage to my jaw and bite than help. I think overall this is a lost cause for me but maybe someone else will have better luck.
title: Not really a fan

review_text:
There is no doubt Korean beauty products are the best. These cleansing pads are such a great addition to your night beauty routine.
It comes in a great quality bottle, comes sealed, includes some tweezers to avoid contaminating all other pads.

It has a sweet fresh scent that is very pleasant. One pad is enough to remove makeup, eyes included. Once you are done, it leaves a slightly oily feeling which is absorbed pretty fast. I thought I wouldn't like that feeling since I am not a big fan of greasy feeling on my face. However, this is very light and helps moisturizing the skin.

Regarding the ingredients, I am happy to see it does not contain any synthetic fragrance that is high hazard for the skin and it is a very common ingredient in skin care products. It also contains jojoba oil that is very moisturizing and Centella Asiatica (Cica) that soothes and brighten the skin. Not to mention Eggplant extract that has antioxidants.

The only callout would be to include a way to keep the tweezers attached to the lid, this way you don't have to put them on top of the wipes or keep them outside the closed bottle that could possibly get lost.
title: Beautiful package, effective product!

review_text: I got these for one of my granddaughters who love blue. The pictures don't do justice to how pretty the color is! It was very easy to put in her hair that now I want some for myself!! The pack had more than enough to cover her whole head and lasted for almost 6 weeks when I put in braided extensions.  And it didn't have a smell like some other hair can have. Really nice hair!!
title: Really nice hair

review_text:
Cucumbers are supposed to be amazing for the skin. So, I wanted to give these a go.

Pro: - moisten. Very moist.
- mask doesn't rip or tear
- plastic backing for easier application
- gentle, pleasant aroma
- sinks quickly into skin after massaging at end

Cons: - thin
- hard to slide into place...and then doesn't fit quite right
- suggested wear time is 20-25 mins....longer than usual

These masks come individually packaged in robust and easy to open pouches. The mask has a sturdy, plastic backing, which is the only reason it can be unfolded and placed on without any trouble because these are thin. Surprisingly, they don't rip or tear easily, though. After taking off the backing, it takes a little maneuvering to get these to sit in place. Firstly, the thin material wanted to bunch and roll along the edges of the face, and the lack of thickness made it difficult to get to lay flat. Also, the eye holes aren't quite right. I, my son, and my daughter tried them (each with very different face sizes) and all of us had trouble with the eyes. When they were in position, The bridge of the nose wouldn't stay pressed against the skin, but kept lifting up. The suggested wear time is 20 to 25 minutes, which is longer than the 15 to 20 I normally see on masks. Removing the mask, however, is no problem, and there's a good amount of moisture left over to massage into the skin....which also works well

The masks are moistening and have a gentle, pleasant odor (although I can't really place it). These are refreshing and leave the skin shiny. If only they'd sit better, I'd enjoy them more.
title: Moistens

review_text:
The foundation provides great coverage.
I have acne-prone skin and have dark spots, uneven tones, ‚Äãand acne scars and this foundation does a great job in covering all the imperfections.
Another thing that I like is that a little goes a long way. A pea-size amount covers most of my face. I don't like thick layers of make-up, since it clogs my pores up, so I usually just wear one coat and one coat of this foundation provides great coverage.
I have been wearing this foundation for about 2 weeks (off & on) and it does not cause break-outs.
I hope they continue selling this because I have found my foundation.
Love the bag and the primer, the sponges not so much.
title: Great coverage on my acne scarred skin

review_text:
This is the second set of spray bottles of this type that I have ordered. Each set has been from a different brand/seller. They both perform exactly the same. I use them to make my own household cleaners, room sprays, toilet sprays, etc. I'm not a fan of our cultures plastic addiction & try to reduce my impact on the planet when I can. Running my own eco family farm full time helps considerably ;)

I like everything about these bottles except for the same exact thing I don't like about my other set of bottles, the spray head rotates easily. It doesn't unscrew, that's not what I'm talking about. It's the spray head itself. I think if the bottle wasn't so heavy this wouldn't be an issue, but when spraying downward, the bottle will move due to the weight. If I hold the bottle with one hand, while spraying with the other, all is well.

A possible solution to this might be to purchase these 16 oz amber glass bottles separately, then purchase a separate pack of very highly rated, top quality spray nozzles & a sheet of labels to see if that helps. Perhaps these sets are being sold with lower quality spray nozzles. I really cannot say. I currently don't have a need to order a bunch of bottles in this size & enjoy the convenience of having a ready made kit of 2, so for now, I'm happy enough with what I have.
title: Beautiful Upgrade for DIY from Polluting Plastic Bottles

review_text: The colors are fine and cover pretty well with one coat. The glitter swatches have 2 coats. All swatches were cured for 2 minutes between each coat. The main issue I have with the set is that the bottles are plastic and don't seem to have very much polish in them. For the price, I think a buyer would be expecting more. This set does not come with a base and top coat.
title: Not overly impressed, especially for the price...

review_text: I absolutely love these scrunchies. I‚Äôve used them every single day since I got them and they‚Äôve held up amazing. They still feel and look like when I first got them. I have waist length, thick hair and these have no issues holding it up. Plus the silk helps not to damage your hair.
title: Love them!

review_text: The "TCM Mancode 101 Men's Hair Conditioner" has a very nice scent, not overpowering just right. I had my husband try the conditioner following all the direction. The directions have you shampooing your hair and towel dry, then taking a palm sized amount to massage ( I think that is more than you need) from ends to scalp. Then comb with wide tooth comb from the scalp upward to the ends and let it stay in for 5 minutes ( this is a negative to me ...5 minutes waiting is too long). Finally rinse thoroughly and style. It is infused with tea tree oil and Chia seed oil. My husband agreed with my thoughts on amount of product and time. He thought it was just okay, nothing fantastic. The product comes in a metal container - the one I received not dings and creases on the outside but no damage in the inside of container.
title: Nice Scent

review_text:
This mask is a little bit different from others, Many are like paper. This one is a bit heavier and you will want to probably lay down while you have this on so that it doesn't slip. Follow the Directions: STEP 1. Remove the film
Clear up the skin with toner after cleansing, take the mask pack and remove the white film on one side. STEP 2. Attach the mask pack. Attach the upper half with your eyes at the center and the lower half with your mouth at the center. Tip! It is better to attach the lower part first. STEP 3. Absorption. Remove the mask after 30 minutes and absorb the essence remaining on the skin by lightly tapping it with your fingers. The final on this mask is that it feels good, it does a good job and I am glad there are 3 more I can use before I have to buy more
title: When you use them, follow directions

review_text:
I get "outbreaks" on my hands sometimes. Usually when my hands get bad (even just one hand) I have to apply a cortisone rub a few times a day over a few days to make the redness, flakiness, and itchiness subside.

I was hesitant to get this because the ingredients seem pretty simple for something that is supposed to make a difference in psoriasis. Well I am surprised at how effective this spray is. Instead of touching the cortisone rub at all - I just sprayed this on the backs of my hands. Granted I was working form home for the entire day - so I pretty much sprayed it a bunch of times over the course of the day. The redness got MUCH better. And the flakiness totally went away. The only thing is my skin on the bad hand looked a bit dry - but I guess that is because this is a spray and not an emollient cream or anything. To the touch, my hand felt pretty soft with only the slightest dry patches felt. Anytime I can avoid cortisone (steroids) I consider a really good time.

I am happy with this spray and have a feeling I will always have to keep some on hand going forward. Some might think the price may be a bit much - but if it works...plus if you can avoid drugs - it is probably worth it. Plus the bottle may last quite sometime anyway.

If you thought my review was helpful - why not click the "Helpful" button. Thanks! : )
title: Surprisingly, it really makes a difference!

review_text:
I ordered this more for the brow filler than the stencils. I actually have a few sets of these stencils and they're very hard to use properly. If you are heavy handed at all then your brows will end up much wider than you're wanting and if you use a light touch to apply the makeup it's difficult to keep the stencil in the same place long enough to finish them.
Overall the stencils are a great guideline if you have some patience but that's about it.

The brow cream itself was great quality though! I really couldn't tell much of a difference between it and my much more costly name brand cream brow filler. The brush that was included isn't nearly as fine and high quality but I have my own so that wasn't an issue and the makeup alone was well worth the cost of this whole kit.

A great value for the makeup alone, the rest of the stuff I just view as extras and if they happen to work well for you then that's a fabulous bonus!
title: The stencils are meh but the brown cream is great

review_text: This is nice product. It's non-greasy and does minimize the appearance of my lines. Unlike many serums that leave me greasy and sticky, this one does not. In these times, a little self-care goes a long way. I love using this in the morning and at night.
title: Love this product

review_text:
I included a half make-up, half naked skin photo, taken with my phones portrait filter off, to give you some sense of how this foundation looks.
I was fortunate in that the time I spent studying the shades on the product page paid off with a pretty spot on color match for my skin, which had me very excited.

Regarding how the make-up went on, I actually found I got better results applying it with my finger than I did with the included make-up sponge.
I know using a sponge is better for your skin, but I found it just kept blending the foundation right off my face.
Whether that was a result of how I applied it, the foundation itself, and/or the sponge is up for debate.
Since you get two sponges included with the two bottles of make-up, you can experiment and decide what application method works best for you.
Side note, this is way too thick to be air brushed on and can't be diluted, so if you use an airbrush, this foundation probably isn't for you.

Regarding how the foundation looked and felt, I would say, standard.
This reminded me of pretty much every good quality foundation I have ever tried.
- It looks best after you first put it on
- It covers many, but not all marks and discoloration
- As the end of the day approaches, it starts to look "fatigued"
- It will wipe off on hands, clothing, etc... if you rub your face
- You need to put some effort into getting all traces of the foundation cleaned off at the end of the day
- For best results, you'll probably want to pair it with a spot concealer and finishing powder

Overall, this is a solid foundation that performs well, but is not exceptional.
If you get a good match to your skin tone like I did, I suspect you will be very pleased with this make-up set.
In the end, I would definitely recommend this, so long as you understand this is not the ultimate fix all your problems, find your prince, do your taxes, and make you smarter miracle in a bottle all foundations claim to be, but instead, a quality make-up that will give you good coverage.
title: Got a perfect color match with decent coverage

review_text: I wanted to try this because it's the perfect size for what I need it for. I make a formula to spray on my synthetic wigs to make them smell nice and freshen them up between washes. This has a nice even mist spray which is exactly what I need. Plus I love the green. I recommend this bottle if this is the size you're looking for.

review_text:
Holy cow was this hard to use on long hair.

I had long hair that was down to my waist, but when curled, was about the length to my chest. This product was by far the MOST difficult to use because no matter how I sectioned the hair, it ALWAYS managed to get stuck or tangled in either the silicone or stick, while pulling the hair through the tube.

In the end, there also wasn't enough tubes to curl my whole head. I also ripped, tangled hair, and on top of that, when I assembled the blue stick (originally in 2 pieces), I was unable to detach it for traveling (?????). I ended up breaking it in order to detach it. Not to mention that some of the tubes also had bits of silicone (on the edges of the tube, to prevent slipping, I assume) that were already ripped. This was HORRIBLE because it would also contribute to the ripping and tangling of my hair.

This was just a whole nightmare to use. I would skip out on this product.
title: If you value your long hair, skip it.

review_text:
Forever in search of the perfect skin care products, I ordered this eye cream.
I always try it on the back of my hand first to see what it feels like & what it smells like - it‚Äôs very creamy but not thick & has no odor at all.
Then I dot some on my forehead to see how it absorbs & how it dries & to make sure there‚Äôs no reaction on my very dry & sensitive skin - it‚Äôs very light & dries quickly. Leaves a bit of stickiness that dissipates.
Finally I dot the cream all over my undereye area & hope for the best!

In this case, it‚Äôs great. I‚Äôve been using it for several days now at night after a shower & again in the morning before makeup.
I really don‚Äôt expect all the magical things to happen that are listed on eye creams, so suffice to say it‚Äôs moisturizing, it spreads easily, & my undereye area feels soft & smooth after using.
All good!

**Thank you for reading this review & I hope that it‚Äôs Helpful!** üëÄ
title: An excellent eye cream that passes my ‚Äútests‚Äù! First, do no harm‚Ä¶

The men‚Äôs shampoo/bodywash is a large bottle as you can see compared to the face wash bottle. Considering how much the face wash and lotion are on their own this set is a pretty good deal for everything! Rugged and Dapper is a really good brand especially for med that have sensitive skin! review_text: These clips worked exactly how I expected them too! No issues with curing because they are clear. I would definitely recommend to my friends and family.

review_text: This is really wonderful stuff. The application directions are unusual. Following them, I put four drops (that's what works for me) in my palm, then rub my palms together until they feel warm. Then I pat my face with them, applying the serum all over. I spread it gently afterwards to make sure I haven't missed any areas. The solution is very quickly absorbed and leaves my skin feeling as soft as a baby's bottom, as the old expression says. I'm mean it's reeeealy soft, and not oily or greasy at all. It's AMAZING. What really has me addicted is the smell. It's not floral or citrus, or really like anything I can put my finger on. If I had to, I'd say it's faintly sweet‚Ä¶ possibly herbal? Well, whatever it is, it's intoxicating to me. It lingers just a while after the serum dries and I thoroughly enjoy it. I'd wear this scent as a perfume if it were available. It's not strong or offensive; it's just unique and pleasant. I recommend this with enthusiasm!!
title: My new favorite thing! I'm obsessed with it.

review_text: This is a gentle and hydrating mask. Even though it has a retinol alternative, you can use it over a stronger serum. This is almost like a sleep mask, not all of it absorbs, it keeps a protective layer on your face while you sleep. It really hydrates so you look rested even if you aren‚Äôt.
title: Hydrates and protects

review_text:
This is a pretty little palette, small enough to use for traveling. Contains 12 pans of both shimmer and matte shades. Doesn‚Äôt come with a brush, but no matter, i have plenty of those. It does have a mirror though. The packaging is reminiscent of London, with the Phonebox, and Big Ben printed on the front.

The texture is very blendable, and the shades are very wearable. I‚Äôm not a fan of the ‚Äúnatural look‚Äù makeup, i like a bold eye, and you can have that with this palette. I particularly love the Red, Dark Blue, Gray and Black shades. And if you find that you want the red to look darker, you can add a bit of black into the crease, and deepen it. I always want palettes to have a black pan - it‚Äôs useful for other things like lining, and smoking out.

If you choose to use an eyeshadow primer (or even just a concealer or foundation) then the colour payoff is more intense. If you don‚Äôt wear a primer, you might need to add more on top. I always wear a primer, because it makes sure the eyeshadow stays on longer, and prevents it settling into my crease.

Essence have some very good products, i first bought their products way back in 2007, in a bricks and mortar store, and they were so affordable, and such good quality. And they have really upped their game, and expanded their range of products over the years. To be honest, i don‚Äôt really often buy drugstore brands any more, and it is a long whole since i shopped Essence, but when this popped up, i was drawn to it, like a moth to a flame, as i love eyeshadow palettes almost as much as i love shoes and bags.

I am not at all disappointed with the quality of the product, the price, and the cute packaging.
title: Great Value

review_text: I ended up liking this Pedicure tub more than I shouldüòä! It has many uses not just for your feet! The fact that it collapses makes it a very wise option for small houses or apartments! Material feels durable and should last a long time! The bottom of the bucket also has a pattern on it that can gently massage your feet as well as take off dead skin!
title: Very useful!

review_text: I have been using this hair removal device for 2 months now. I used it once every 2 weeks so I've used it 5 times so far. Now, the sessions will be only once a month until all the unwated hair is removed. The manufacturer recommends using it once every 2 weeks for the first 5 sessions and then once a month after that, so using it multiple times a week won't change the outcome. The areas I use this device are my legs, under arms, bikini area and upper lip. The only difference I've noticed so far is the upper lip hair. It is growing significantly less, like almost 90% is gone. The rest of the body hair still grows the same amount, but the hair started to grow softer. I assume the hair is finally becoming weaker. I am half Greek and half Italian, I have olive skin color with dark hair, so it might take over a year for me to see some results. Overall, the device is very easy to use and it is painless, but it gets super hot to the touch after about 5-10 minutes of continues usage. I use the device on my legs first and then take a break until it cools down, and then I continue using it on other parts of the body and stop to cool it down again. I have to admit it is frustrating to stop the session to cool down the device. I don't know if other hair removal devices get this hot. This is my first time using something like this so I can't compare.
title: Painless and easy to use, but the device gets super hot

review_text: I know these wig grips need to be tight in order to work properly and stay on your head, but my goodness it‚Äôs headache inducing. And if you wear glasses it will interfere with putting them on and off. The wig absolutely stays attached to the grip though, so hopefully I can find some in different sizes.

Battery life seems to be fantastic and it has a charge indicator so you know how much power you have left. To clean it you can just rinse it off making it easy to clean. Overall its a decent razor that gets a close shave, without burns.

review_text:
Review for C'est Moi Vanilla Vibes Sugar Balm Body Scrub | Invigorating & Hydrating Exfoliant, Clinically Tested Non-Toxic Ingredients

This is my kind of sugar scrub. It cleans and exfoliates while it also hydrates my skin. When I get out of the tub or shower I don‚Äôt have to apply lotion to my body because the scrub left my skin completely moisturized.

The sugar in this product does the job of exfoliating and making the skin fresh and new. The oil in the product does the moisturizing, much better than just a lotion after because it really coats the skin.

There will be some residue left in the tub or shower that has to be rinsed with really hot water when done or it will be slippery for the next shower or bath.

Definitely a recommend for anyone that understands what this product is.
title: Wonderfully moisturizing

review_text:
I know this is a baby bath oil, but I'm a fan of using bath oils as shave oils. A little goes a long way, just a few drops per leg (or you can add a drop to your regular shave gel). Helps reduce irritation and you can see where you are shaving! I can't live without it. It's better than any foam, gel or lotion on the market. Truly the best shave experience. I have thick hair and dry flaky skin that is prone to itching and sensitivity. I use this bath oil with a cheapie disposable razor and a few drops of body oil after a shower and my legs are silky for days. Literally days. No razor burn, no irritation, no frustration. I prefer unscented products and this is truly unscented--thank you! Please use caution when using oils in the tub, but I haven't had any problems with the tub getting slippery. Only thing I would change in a better bottle with a pump or dropper top. It's easy to use too much. A little goes a long way so if you're hesitant about the price, don't be, because you'll end up spending more in the long run on something cheaper.

Also, used this as a body wash after getting a little too much sun today, and my skin was super soothed. I think it will help prevent my skin from developing a sunburn--bonus! I may just have to buy a vat of this!

Hope you found this review helpful!
title: Wonderful to Use as a Shave Oil, No More Itchy Legs or Underarms :-)

review_text: Such a neutral pretty color, great product! Love it!
title: Such a neutral pretty color! Great product! Love it!

review_text:
Overall the Karuna 7 Days of Glow mask set has some good masks that do as they say without irritation. While I don't use face masks every day, it has taken me a while to use just a few of them, and specific masks, like the hydration mask, aren't best suited for my face type. Out of the whole set, my favorite masks have been the brightening and antioxidant masks. While I was slightly hesitant to use the antioxidant mask at first due to my oily combo skin, it left me with no clogged pores or irritation, and it brightened and soothed my skin.

As I mentioned initially, I don't use face masks too often, and the masks I usually use are pretty cheap. Trying these masks has ruined me a little because it will be hard to go back to my regular masks. The one thing I don't like about these masks is the price. I think $42 is a little bit much for seven face masks, but it depends on how often you use face masks and how much of a splurge you want them to be. in terms of quality, I think the Karuna masks are great.
title: High Quality Masks that Don't Irritate the Skin

review_text:
There is plenty to like about this kit.

First, I like that it's USB powered. That is a major convenience, especially if using in a professional setting. Secondly, it's got good balance and is ergonomically pleasing. A great feature when you're using is regularly.

My sister, who has been a professional for 20 years, said it was among the sharpest (in a good way!) she's ever used. Obviously this is huge when working on customers and you don't want to pulling hair out when you're trying to cut it.

With the myriad attachments, there's really very little you can't do with it. And best of all, the price is great for what you get. I would recommend this for both home and professional settings.

The battery length isn't great, but it also charges really quickly, so it's simply a matter of being mindful of it.
title: Great for home or the salon

review_text:
Simpligrown baby powder

This is cornstarch, not talc. It's good for those who don't want to use talc. The downside is that it feels coarse, not silky smooth, when being spread over skin.

I got this primarily because of the container. It looks nicer than the usual all white bottles of baby powder. I just refill from my larger bottles.
title: feels like all other cornstarch

review_text:
The directions on the tube of FRESHME's mud mask (pelargonium graveolens) state those with sensitive skin should use the mud mask once a week. Because I have sensitive skin that's precisely what I did. I also followed the directions that state the mask should be used after bathing or after warming the skin with a towel for 5 minutes. Perhaps my skin is just too sensitive because I really didn't notice much of a difference after using this mud mask. Its on the light, watery side so its easy to apply and doesn't take much to cover my face. In the 15 minutes it sits on my skin (10-15 recommended per directions) it never entirely dries and I don't experience the feeling of skin tightening at all. After I rinse it off (it rinses without issue), my skin feels clean but a bit dry. I cannot detect any change to my pores. This just isn't the mud mask for me. I've discontinued using it and will be giving the rest to my niece over the holidays. My review will be updated if she has better results than I.

--photo #1-taken right after I put some mask on my hand
--photo#2-taken after mask sat on my hand for 15 minutes (doesn't dry entirely)
title: Not The Right Mud Mask For Me
